text: Urvashi Vaid (8 October 1958 – 14 May 2022) was an Indian-American LGBT activist. She moved to the United States when she was eight. She ended high school after three years. She then went to New York’s Vassar College. After, she went to law school at Northeastern University in Boston. She is lesbian. "Urvashi Vaid." Asian American Reference Library, edited by Helen Zia, et al., 2nd ed., UXL, 2004. Student Resources In Context, http://link.galegroup.com/apps/doc/EJ2131100235/SUIC?u=palo88030&sid;=SUIC&xid;=da255e9d. Accessed 8 May 2018. == Achievements == Vaid supports gay and lesbian rights. She lived in Boston and started the Lesbian Gay Political Alliance. This organization supports the gay people in Boston. After college, she helped prisoners who had HIV. In 1985, she started working at the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force. This group teaches people about the lives of gay and lesbian people. She also started the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force’s Creating Change Conference. In 1995, she wrote a book called Virtual Equality: The Mainstreaming of Gay and Lesbian Liberation. == Death == Vaid died on 14 May 2022 in New York City, aged 63. She had breast and thyroid cancer at the time of her death.Chemo killed the small-talk gene == References == Category:1958 births Category:American LGBT rights activists Category:2022 deaths Category:Indian activists Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Deaths from breast cancer Category:Deaths from thyroid cancer
title: Urvashi Vaid
